reviewText: I think that because all the routines on this DVD have beginner modifications and that they are very realistic, this is the best bootcamp DVD for beginners and those that want to push their limits from beginner to intermediate and intermediate to advanced.  I like the way the instructor focuses on form, breathing, and has both an encouraging and sincere voice.  This is the first time I have done a workout with Tanja Djelevic and look forward to trying her other DVDs and future releases.Full Bootcamp (53 minutes) = Warm-Up, 4 Combos, Abs, and Cool-DownThe routines in Full Bootcamp are not as high cardio as most bootcamp DVDs I've tried, such as Ten Minute Solution Ultimate Bootcamp10 Minute Solution: Ultimate Bootcamp(see my review) and Ten Minute Solution Hot Body Bootcamp10 Minute Solution: Hot Body Boot Camp, but I like the way they progress from easier to harder variations of moves within each combo.  March in place between each transition from move to move and section to section.The Warm-Up and Cool-Down (6/7 Minutes each) are slow stretching of all body parts.Combo 1 (8/9 minutes)Lunges with modifications for beginner, intermediate, and advanced, depending on the hand movement.Slow bending forward with modifications for beginner, intermediate, and advanced depending on how low you squat as you bend.Slow squats with modifications for beginner, intermediate, and advanced depending on how low you squat.Fast squats for intermediate and advanced with beginners joining later.Elbow and side planks with modifications for beginners being on knees and intermediate and advanced being on toes.Combo 2 (7/8 minutes)Intermediate and advanced need what looks to be 2-3 lb weights.  They do a different exercise for each hand.  Bicep curls into triceps extension on one side and overhead presses on the other.  Doing this is supposed to "confuse the body."Start with slow mountain climbers, and then intermediate and advanced go at a faster pace."Under the fence" pushups, which look like going from Downward Dog into Upward Dog with beginners on knees and intermediate and advanced on toes.Combo 3 (6 /7 minutes)Start facing forward. Pivot towards back of room, while you lunge toward back of room.  Beginners don't lunge as far.  Intermediate and advanced pick up one 2-3 lb weight.  Hold in lunge position. On side with leg forward hold weight at chest height with elbow back in row.  On side with leg back, place hand on ground in line with ankle of forward leg.  Bring arm with weight forward towards ankle of same side.  Bring opposite arm towards ceiling as you look back.  This move works entire body.  Switch sides.  Put weight down.Do backward lunges switching legs each time.  First set is fast lunges.  Second set hold each leg for 2 beats.  Third set combines moves from previous sets, so that you switch fast and then hold leg 2 beats.The next move you do a triceps pushup, while bringing one knee forward and perpendicular to side.  After every pushup, switch sides.Combo 4 (10 Minutes)Intermediate and advanced start with one right knee up.  Lunge back.  Bring both legs into plank position. Bring second leg forward into lunge.  Stand up.  Bring knee of right leg back up.  Beginners stay in lunge position and skip the planks, but kick leg instead of knee up.  Do several sets before switching to starting with left knee up.  Add pushups to plank position second round.Intermediate and advanced pick up 2-3 lb weights.  Go into horse stance/sumo squat position.  Hold weights with bent elbows with palms facing toward you.  Straighten arms and twist palms towards ground.  Do several reps slow and then speed up pace.  Put weights down when finished.Start walking forward and back with one leg.  Do several reps lunging forward and back on one leg.  Switch legs.Sit on floor and extend legs with feet flexed and "nice and strong" back.  Raise hands into air and then place palms on ground with fingers facing forward so you are in Staff pose.  Lift weight onto hands so body is slightly off the ground.  After several reps intermediate and advanced raise body into reverse plank position.  Beginners don't raise body as high off the ground.Abs (8 Minutes)Lie on back. Intermediate and advanced raise chest and legs slightly off ground at same time.  Beginners do a crunch only.  All hold that position.  Then, second set raise chest and legs higher until legs are perpendicular to ground.  Advanced start with one leg raised, and then quickly add second leg, as you bring both legs perpendicular.  Arms are straight and parallel to legs.  Hold that position.  If you need any further modifications, hold legs in any of the positions to make it easier.  Third set intermediate and advanced raise arms straight up in air.Bootcamp Express (11 minutes) = A series of 1-2 minute moves that switch between cardio and strength moves using body weight.  Beginners do low impact modifications for all exercises.  Add arm movements to increase intensity.Start with marching, jump rope, jumping side to side, jump rope with kicks to warm up.  Lunge side and front and then switch sides to lunge side and front.  Jog in place, jog with kicks, and forward and back jumps.  "Under the fence" push-ups. Plyometric jumps.  Sit in upward plank position. Kick 1 leg up in air.  Keep same leg until second set.  Next set, arm reaches to side and then to ceiling. Switch sides each time.  Then stick to one side and bring knee up as you reach to knee.  Switch sides. Then back to single reaches to side and to ceiling.  Stretch for short cool down.Bootcamp Full Body Blast (14/15 minutes) = Do 16 counts per side of each exercise.  The moves switch between cardio and strength moves using body weight.  March in place between each transition.  There are modifications for beginners.Step out left and right and then do lunge on one side.  Step out left and right again and do lunge on other side.  Start slow and then speed up to increase intensity.  For the next move, take step back on right leg and then left for a few counts and then open arms as you move forward and back.  Really open wide to stretch back muscles.  Next, do moving squat jumps.  Then, are Windmills.  Next move is a curtsy squat with jumps.  You start with one leg crossed behind and go into squat.  Then, you jump up and do same thing on other side. Next, are "push up stars."  As you do a push up, you bring up one knee towards nose and stretch leg across the body to opposite side, while you bring hand down from that opposite side so it touches ankle.  There is actually a beginner modification where you do pushups on knees and then bring knee up to elbow.  The Advanced level twists oblique muscles more during move.  Then, lunge to side and come up into a jump on same leg.  Use abs to get up as high as you can. Next, are Jumping Jacks with a deep squat and a double bounce.  Modify your arms depending on level.  Then, step back into a runner's lunge and bring up knee.  Modify depth of lunge and height of knee up to fit your level.  Do 1 set each side. Get into straight arm plank position. Move entire body to side and then do push up.  Move body back to original position and do push up.  Sit into reverse plank position. Move into bridge pose while you kick 1 leg straight up. Do 1 set for each leg.  There is no cool down.Customize Your WorkoutYou can select any combination of Combos 1-4, Abs, and Bootcamp Express to run in any order.  When selecting fewer than 6 hit play after you make your selections.  The DVD automatically includes the warm-up and cool-down sections to any single section or combination.I was skeptical of this DVD after the fiasco of Reebok Cardio ToneReebok: Cardio Tone(see my review), so I rented it.  I plan on buying my own copy and can see myself using it quite often.  I recommend this DVD for all levels.
summary: A Bootcamp Workout for All Levels
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this DVD because I wanted to mix up my routine and make it more challenging.  I made my decision based on the reviews, but I have to say that it fell far short of my expectations--and that's saying a lot given that I tried it for the first time after a very loooong and stressful day.  It's probably a good beginner/intermediate workout, but Tanja takes longer breaks than what I personally prefer.  It's not enough to really test your limits.  I'd rather keep my heart rate up and really feel like I pushed as hard as possible afterwards.  I guess this will just have to be one of my new go-to's on my light days.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This exercise DVD is NOT for people who are looking for a cardiovascular workout. It is almost exclusively sculpting and weight training, not as advertised. I workout quite often and I thought many of the movements on the Abs segment of the workout were so difficult that I was not even able to complete them. I would not recommend this to a friend, it did not fulfill my expectations.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Reebok Bootcamp has 3 main workouts to choose from on main menu. Also, you have the option to customize your workout by choosing from 7 express workouts.Full Bootcamp (53 min.) - 5 combinationsBootCamp Express (11 min.) - a series of moves done for 1 minute eachBootCamp Full Body Blast (15 min.) - BONUS workout - 16 counts of each moveTanja Djelevic does a great job adding variety to the traditional "bootcamp" moves.  She has modifications for advanced & beginner.  Tanja usually demonstrates for the intermediate exerciser. She explains the movements clearly, and her cueing is right on.  I appreciate her pleasant personality =)You will need a pair of 3-5 lb hand weights.Breakdown Full BootCamp:Warm Up (6 min)- Tanja does a nice warm up, thoroughly warming up the body.  Two parts stood out to me; In the beginning, a stretch for the spine that feels amazing, towards the end a great hip flexor stretch series.Combo 1:*Lateral lunge followed by a forward lunge, alternate legs*Back Extensions - place hands behind head, bend knees & tilt forward, then bend upper body down to hip level &  pull back up. Works glutes & lower back.*Squat Jumps - turn 180 degrees each jump*Elbow Plank - begin on elbows,then turn to side plank with arm reaching up, back to start, opposite sideCombo 2:*GET WEIGHTS  One arm overhead press, opposite arm bicep curl/tricep extension*Tennis Lunge - In plank position bring right leg forward next to hand, back to plank, left leg forwardProgresses to jump & switch legs*Going under the Fence Push ups - In downward dog with knees bent, move forward as if going under a fence, push back to downward dogCombo 3:*Lunge towards back corner - lift up on toe, pivot & lunge to back corner. Alternating legs.*Deep Lunge w/ one arm row & spinal twist (balance check!)*Reverse Lunge - pulse two, switch legs..progresses to 2 bounces & jump switch*Military Pushups for Triceps - face elbows towards back, when moving down, drag knee up towards shoulder, push up & leg goes back, then alternate legCombo 4:*Start from a standing position, right knee back, left knee back to plank - left knee forward and stand up brining right knee up. More advanced - add push up when go back with leg.*Using lighter weights, sit into hips. Drag elbows in with palms up, then push out & rotate palms. This quick movement is done with pulse plies.*Bicycle Lunges - start moving forward & back keeping one leg anchored...progressing deeper into lunge*Reverse PlanksAb Combo:*Plank position, move leg up, then bend in towards chest*Elbow side plank, bring arm down four counts & back up four counts*Side plank - thread the needle - twist and bring arm down & towards back (crunching obliques)*Boat Poses - start out laying flat on floor, lift shoulders & legs off floor, then up to full seated boat poseCool Down (5 min.) - A much appreciated cool down!EXPRESS Workout (about 12 min.) - Jump rope, lateral/forward lunge combo, jump forward & back on right leg(then left leg), under the fence push ups, squat jumps 90 degrees, sitting down-glute squeeze kicking leg up, tap side to side & sweep arms, repeater knee right, repeater knee left, cool downBONUS Workout (15 min) - Split squats, reverse lunge & chest stretch, squat jumps 180 degrees, Windmill, lateral hop with diag. lunge back, push ups with leg twist/arm reach(yikes!), deep squat w/ double bounce, runners lunge to knee up(anchored leg up on toe), push up with lateral walk/cross, sitting - push arms up & kick leg up, cool downThis workout has some excellent moves, especially for upper body.  I recommend this for intermediate to advanced exercisers.  For advanced exercisers, this is a great workout for light days =) If you have knee problems, you should probably skip this one.  I enjoyed this workout, and really worked up a sweat!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of the worst exercise dvds that I own. I like Tanja as an instructor, but all of her workouts are way too easy and only for beginners. This dvd was way too disjointed because all the segments are really short, such as two exercises per workout on some segments. My heart rate never went up and I just felt it was a waste of time. If you really are new to exercise this might actually be a really good start and I do recommend it for beginners.
Title: N/A
